soc.game

Class SOCBoard4p

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.game.SOCBoard
      • soc.game.SOCBoard4p
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SOCBoard4p
extends SOCBoard
    The classic 4-player board with 19 land hexes, surrounded by a ring of 18 sea hexes/ports. Implements SOCBoard.BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL.
    Since:
    2.0.00
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Since:
        1.1.11

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PORTS_TYPE_V1

        public static final int[] PORTS_TYPE_V1
        Each port's type, such as SOCBoard.SHEEP_PORT, on classic board. Same order as PORTS_FACING_V1. SOCBoard.MISC_PORT is 0.
        Since:
        1.1.08

      • PORTS_HEXNUM_V1

        static final int[] PORTS_HEXNUM_V1
        Each port's hex number within SOCBoard.hexLayout on classic board. Same order as PORTS_FACING_V1: Clockwise from upper-left (hex coordinate 0x17).
        Since:
        1.1.08

      • PORTS_FACING_V1

        static final int[] PORTS_FACING_V1
        Each port's facing towards land, on the classic board. Ordered clockwise from upper-left (hex coordinate 0x17). Port Facing is the direction from the port hex/edge, to the land hex touching it which will have 2 nodes where a port settlement/city can be built. Facing 2 is east (SOCBoard.FACING_E), 3 is SE, 4 is SW, etc; see SOCBoard.hexLayout.
        Since:
        1.1.08

      • PORTS_EDGE_V1

        static final int[] PORTS_EDGE_V1
        Each port's 2 node coordinates on classic board. Same order as PORTS_FACING_V1: Clockwise from upper-left (hex coordinate 0x17).
        Since:
        1.1.08

      • makeNewBoard_numPaths_v1

        static final int[][] makeNewBoard_numPaths_v1
        Possible number paths for 4-player original board. SOCBoard.makeNewBoard(SOCGameOptionSet) randomly chooses one path (one 1-dimensional array) to be used as numPath[] in SOCBoard.makeNewBoard_placeHexes(int[], int[], int[], SOCGameOption).

        public SOCBoard4p(SOCGameOptionSet gameOpts)

    • Method Detail

      • getPortsFacing

        public int[] getPortsFacing()
        Description copied from class: SOCBoard
        Each port's facing, such as SOCBoard.FACING_NW. Port Facing is the direction from the port hex, to the land hex touching it which will have 2 nodes where a port settlement/city can be built. Same order as SOCBoard.getPortsLayout(): Clockwise from upper-left. The length of this array is always SOCBoard.getPortsCount().

        This method should not be called frequently.

        Specified by:
        getPortsFacing in class SOCBoard
        Returns:
        the ports' facing
        See Also:
        SOCBoard.getPortsEdges()

      • getPortsEdges

        public int[] getPortsEdges()
        Description copied from class: SOCBoard
        Each port's edge coordinate. This is the edge whose 2 end nodes can be used to build port settlements/cities. Same order as SOCBoard.getPortsLayout(): Clockwise from upper-left. The length of this array is always SOCBoard.getPortsCount().

        This method should not be called frequently.

        A scenario of SOCBoardLarge has movable ports; a port's edge there might temporarily be -1. Ignore this port if so, it's not currently placed on the board. This happens only with SOCBoardLarge (layout encoding v3), not the original or 6-player (v1 or v2) SOCBoard layouts.

        Specified by:
        getPortsEdges in class SOCBoard
        Returns:
        the ports' edges
        See Also:
        SOCBoard.getPortsFacing(), SOCBoard.getPortCoordinates(int)

      • getLandHexCoords

        public int[] getLandHexCoords()
        Description copied from class: SOCBoard
        The hex coordinates of all land hexes. May be constant or built at call time; see subclass javadocs for this method.

        Before v2.0.00 this was getHexLandCoords().

        Specified by:
        getLandHexCoords in class SOCBoard
        Returns:
        land hex coordinates, in no particular order, or null if none (all water).

      • getPortsCount

        public int getPortsCount()
        Description copied from class: SOCBoard
        Get the number of ports on this board. The original and 6-player board layouts each have a constant number of ports. The v3 layout (SOCBoard.BOARD_ENCODING_LARGE) has a varying amount of ports, set during SOCBoard.makeNewBoard(SOCGameOptionSet).
        Specified by:
        getPortsCount in class SOCBoard
        Returns:
        the number of ports on this board; might be 0 if SOCBoard.makeNewBoard(SOCGameOptionSet) hasn't been called yet.
